__prompts__.supportedMinecraftVersions: Enter which versions of minecraft should the mod support:
__prompts__.modId: Enter the id for your mod:
__prompts__.modVersion: Enter the version of your mod:
__prompts__.modName: Enter the name of your mod:
__prompts__.modDescription: Enter a description for your mod:
__prompts__.modMainClass: Enter a name for your mods main class:
__prompts__.modGroup: Enter the maven group for your mod:
__prompts__.modAuthor: Enter the name of the author of the mod:
__prompts__.modSources: Enter the link to your mods sources:
__prompts__.includeBlockRegistryClass: Do you want a block registry class? You will probably also want Fabric API.
__prompts__.includeItemRegistryClass: Do you want an item registry class? You will probably also want Fabric API.
__prompts__.includeConfigLibrary: Do you want a config class? This uses my own library.
__prompts__.initGit: Do you want a git repository to be initialized?
